title: Problem running local/private merge test-net with Geth
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description I'm trying to run a private merge test-net. When starting the validator it gives the error `INFO validator: Waiting for beacon node to sync to latest chain head` every two seconds. And on the beacon-chain client traces show me `DEBUG initial-sync: Can not process event epoch=0 error=no peers available, waiting for reconnect event=dataReceived` ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Surprisingly, the same version and work-flow was working for me until several days ago. But now it's 3 days that I'm struggling to run my network and it's not working ... ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Four terminals (bootnode, geth, beacon-chain, validator) 1. bootnode: `./build/bin/bootnode -genkey boot.key` 2. bootnode: `./build/bin/bootnode -nodekey boot.key -addr :30305 -verbosity 5` (gives me the `enode://a84cf7f847189f047189d39f58559337603be8e976a85778f872107883daec86a8b55fec7f7146972b45c3e593978aa3250933c4727b795731840d45d6eb7848@127.0.0.1:0?discport=30305` address) 3. geth: `./build/bin/geth --datadir private/miner/ account new` (gives me the `0x80a56F303424F4B5d9cEA62dB70FE657d1746070` address) 4. geth: `./build/bin/geth init --datadir private/miner genesis-merge.json` 5. beacon-chain: `../prysmctl testnet generate-genesis --num-validators=64 --output-ssz=genesis.ssz --chain-config-file=config.yml` 6. geth: `./build/bin/geth --datadir private/miner --port 30307 --bootnodes enode://a84cf7f847189f047189d39f58559337603be8e976a85778f872107883daec86a8b55fec7f7146972b45c3e593978aa3250933c4727b795731840d45d6eb7848@127.0.0.1:0?discport=30305 --networkid 24 --unlock 0x80a56F303424F4B5d9cEA62dB70FE657d1746070 --miner.threads=3 --mine console --syncmode=full` 7. beacon-chain: `../beacon-chain --datadir=beacondata --min-sync-peers=0 --interop-genesis-state=genesis.ssz --interop-eth1data-votes --bootstrap-node=enode://a84cf7f847189f047189d39f58559337603be8e976a85778f872107883daec86a8b55fec7f7146972b45c3e593978aa3250933c4727b795731840d45d6eb7848@127.0.0.1:0?discport=30305 --chain-config-file=config.yml --config-file=config.yml --chain-id=24 --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 --accept-terms-of-use --jwt-secret=../go-ethereum/private/miner/geth/jwtsecret --contract-deployment-block 0 --verbosity=trace --log-file=tmp.out` 8. validator: `../validator --datadir=validatordata --accept-terms-of-use --interop-num-validators=64 --interop-start-index=0 --force-clear-db --chain-config-file=config.yml --config-file=config.yml` After reaching the block number 307, TTD condition is reached, but the merge doesn't happen. ## üî• Log These are the log output of every of the geth, validator, and beacon-chain terminals: geth:

@prestonvanloon Is this waiting on any action items from the discussion

Not sure. @rauljordan was helping with this issue and I don't know if it
was resolved or not

I think we can mark it as closed. 
To mention a few points for anyone who might face to the same problem:

- The above config and genesis files should work for a POW network. 
- Make sure to regenerate the genesis file everytime you want to run the network from scratch (via `prysmctl testnet generate-genesis --num-validators=64 --output-ssz=genesis.ssz --chain-config-file=config.yml`).
- Decreasing the number of validators (less than 64) will result in mismatch in block number in execution layer and consensus layer after the merge. 64 is a safe number.
